required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Continuous Intrapartum Support to Reduce Primary Cesarean
clinical_study.official_title: Continuous Intrapartum Support to Reduce Primary Cesarean

lead_sponsor.agency: IMSS Hospital General de Zona 4, Celaya, Guanajauto, Mexico

collaborator.agency: Fondo de Investigación en Salud (FIS), México

clinical_study.source: IMSS Hospital General de Zona 4, Celaya, Guanajauto, Mexico

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study was to evaluate the intervention of intrapartum continuous support by a professional nurse with a university degree to reduce the nulliparous, term, singleton, vertex (NTSV) cesarean birth rate, in women pregnant less than 40 years in the HGZ No. 4 of the Guanajuato delegation of the Mexican Institute of Social Security, Mexico

detailed_description.textblock: Continuous intrapartum support is a strategy used to decrease the cesarean section rate, where multiple factors influence its effectiveness (start and duration of support, professional training of support staff, and others.). The objective of the study was to decrease the rate of deliveries by cesarean, through continuous intrapartum support during the active phase until birth, by a professional nurse with a university degree, the support was based on three basic aspects: 1) emotional support, 2) physical support and comfort measures and 3) information and counseling, for which a quasi-experimental study was conducted, with a study population of 115 women in labour (nulliparous, full-term, single product, vertex position) and under 40 years, a group control was formed (n = 55) who received routine maternal care and a study group (n = 60) who received continuous intrapartum support.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The control group was composed of women with labour, who attended the General Hospital of Zone 4 of the Guanajuato Delegation of the IMSS in the period of October-December 2016. The study group was composed of women with labour who presented at the same hospital to receive obstetric care in the period of October - December 2018.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Until the occurrence of delivery (expected range from 6 hours to 12 hours)
primary_outcome.description: Percentage de cesarean section in the arms

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the active phase up to delivery (expected range from 6 hours to 12 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: Labour covered the period of time from the active phase to birth. (Hours)
Is a quick test performed on a baby at 1 and 5 minutes after birth

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the active phase up to delivery (expected range from 6 hours to 12 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: If obstetric analgesia was applied to reduce the pain of labour. (Yes/No) If obstetric analgesia was applied to reduce the pain of labour. (Yes/No)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: start of active phase (up to 1 hour)
secondary_outcome.description: If oxytocin was used to induce labour. (Yes/No).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Women in labor with continuous intrapartum support
arm_group.description: Continuous intrapartum support was based on three basic aspects: 1) emotional support, 2) physical support and comfort measures and 3) information and advice.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Women in labor without continuous intrapartum support.
arm_group.description: The no intervention group received the usual obstetric care, without continuous intrapartum support.

intervention.description: Received the usual obstetric care plus continuous intrapartum support that was provided by a Bachelor of Nursing and Obstetrics who received prior training by a professional doula.
intervention.arm_group_label: Women in labor with continuous intrapartum support

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women pregnant
- Nulliparous
- Term pregnancy
- Singleton pregnancy
- Vertex position
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with maternal, fetal, or mixed cesarean indications were excluded.

overall_official.affiliation: IMSS Hospital General de Zona 4, Celaya, Guanajauto, México
